channel.title: How do I make an item not be invis? [PI]
channel.description: Okay so, In my client I added a custom item. It work's, it's in the right slot, but there is one problem.. It's invisible. Now I believe it's source sided, but I'm not sure. So if you know what the problem is please tell me.

item.title: How do I make an item not be invis? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @DcnScape DcnScape
item.description:
@DcnScape wrote:

I found out how to do that, but now I got this error:

client.java:105: ';' expected ssors[].method234(abyte0.length, abyte0, ModelIndex); ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .
I thought if I maybe took out the “[]” or made the ‘m’ a capital ‘M’. But I still get the same error. It say’s, “;” expected, but when I tried to add that instead of the “ssors[].” I put “ssors[];” I got an even bigger error.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I make an item not be invis? [PI]

item.title: How do I make an item not be invis? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @DcnScape DcnScape
item.description:
@DcnScape wrote:

I did add the model, you can wear the item. The item is in the correct spot, when you wield it. It’s just it’s invisible in your inventory, and when you wear it, you can see it on your character, just not in the wielding tab it self.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I make an item not be invis? [PI]
item.dc:creator: @DcnScape DcnScape
item.description:
@DcnScape wrote:

public void preloadModels() { File file = new File("./Raw/"); File[] fileArray = file.listFiles(); for(int y = 0; y < fileArray.length; y++) { String s = fileArray[y].getName(); byte[] buffer = ReadFile("./Raw/"+s); Model.method460(buffer,Integer.parseInt(getFileNameWithoutExtension(s)));
Would I change the “(”./Raw/")" ? Would I take out the “/'s”?

Read full topic

item.description:
@tyler28852 wrote:

to enable preloading go into either itemdef class or itemdef_2 class, search preloadingModels() and remove the slashes
